title.narrative: Andhra Pradesh Health Systems Strengthening Project

description.narrative: The Project Development Objectives are to improve the quality and responsiveness of public health services and increase access of the population to an expanded package of primary health services.

condition.narrative: Project Agreement, Schedule, Section I, Part A, Para 1: the Project Implementing Entity maintain throughout the period ofimplementation of the Project, a Project Coordination Cell (PCC) under the National Health Mission (NHM) in DoHFW, headed by astate mission director, NHM, to be responsible for the day-to-day management and coordination of the Project.

Project Agreement, Schedule, Section I, Part A, Para 2: the Project Implementing Entity shall appoint, not later than one monthafter the Effective Date, and thereafter maintain throughout Project implementation, an independent DLI verification agent havingqualifications and terms of reference acceptable to the Bank to verify the achievement of selected DLRs as provided in Schedule 3to the Loan Agreement.

title.narrative: Increase in percentage of patients diagnosed and at risk of hypertension and diabetes, managed as per protocol at the SC or PHC

baseline.value: Baseline to be established following development of clinical protocols

target.value: Increase in baseline value by 2 percentage point

actual.value: Clinical protocols for NCD screening and risk stratification defined. Baseline to be established once NCD system is installed atPHC and CHCs

title.narrative: Increase in the percentage of patients accessing their individual EMR
Increase in the number of facilities where the system for measuring and reporting on patient experience is operational
Increase in the number of health facilities with an operational integrated online patient management system
Increase in the number of functional health and wellness centres (HWCs)
Percentage of districts organizing quarterly review meetings on patient feedback
Increase in the number of CHCs and PHCs with more than 70 percent quality accreditation score following the State-level internal assessment
Increase in the number of CHCs covered by a core package of services contributing towards quality of care
Increase in number of CHCs and PHCs with quality certification
Increase in the percent of male population screened and stratified by risk as per clinical protocols for hypertension and diabetes
Increase in the percent of adult population screened and stratified by risk as per clinical protocols for hypertension and diabetes
Increase in the percent of female population screened and stratified by risk as per clinical protocols for hypertension and diabetes
Increase in the percentage of women above age 30 years screened for cervical cancer at subcenters or PHC facilities
Increase in the number of subcenters with trained mid-level service providers
Increase in the number of districts with at least 90% of pregnant women receiving full ante-natal care
Increase in the percentage of CHCs achieving at least 90% sanitation score monthly for a period of at least six months in a year
Increase in the average patient reported experience score

baseline.value: Baseline to be established for patient reported experience

actual.value: Baseline to be established for patient reported experience

title.narrative: Improvement in the pharmaceutical stock management system at the PHCs and CHCs

baseline.value: Existing system provides information on current stock, but has limited advanced functions such as auto alerts indicating low stock

target.value: Quarterly stock- status reports for PHCs and CHCs generated

actual.value: Existing system provides information on current stock, but has limited advanced functions such as auto alerts indicating low stock

title.narrative: Establish and operate a quality tracking dashboard covering PHC and CHC facilities for supporting quality improvement and maintenance

target.value: 100 PHC and CHC facilities included in quarterly dashboard reports

title.narrative: Research and evaluation undertaken to support the innovative approaches to delivery of primary health care

baseline.value: Population-based survey of NCD risk factor prevalence not undertaken and e-subcenter model overall effectiveness not evaluated

target.value: End-line study for evaluation on e-subcenter completed

actual.value: Population-based survey of NCD risk factor prevalence not undertaken and e-subcenter model overall effectiveness not evaluated

title.narrative: Establish a system for routine maintenance and repair for bio-medical equipment at the CHC level
